objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The authoring organization of the threat report, as stated in the YARA rule metadata and the report disclaimer.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat Malware Path
objects.description: File path where the Pygmy Goat malware is stored on the infected device.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC Socket
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket created by Pygmy Goat for inter-process communication.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC Socket
objects.description: IPC Unix client socket created by Pygmy Goat, likely to masquerade as a legitimate FortiGate process.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat Older Variant IPC Socket
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket used by an older variant of the Pygmy Goat malware.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat PID Lock File
objects.description: Single-instance PID lock file created by Pygmy Goat to ensure only one instance is running. Note the typo 'sshdd' instead of 'sshd'.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat Older Variant PID Lock File
objects.description: Single-instance PID lock file created by an older variant of Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so Payload (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Pygmy Goat malicious shared object.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so Payload (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Pygmy Goat malicious shared object.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so Payload (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Pygmy Goat malicious shared object.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so Payload (Older Variant) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of an older, VMProtect obfuscated variant of the libsophos.so malware.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so Payload (Older Variant) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of an older, VMProtect obfuscated variant of the libsophos.so malware.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so Payload (Older Variant) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of an older, VMProtect obfuscated variant of the libsophos.so malware.

objects.name: Indicator for Embedded TLS Root CA Certificate (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to verify its C2 server, masquerading as Fortinet Ltd.

objects.name: Indicator for Embedded TLS Root CA Certificate (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to verify its C2 server, masquerading as Fortinet Ltd.

objects.name: Indicator for Embedded TLS Root CA Certificate (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to verify its C2 server, masquerading as Fortinet Ltd.

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: A native x86-32 ELF shared object, also known as libsophos.so, discovered on Sophos XG firewall devices. It provides backdoor access to the compromised device. Pygmy Goat achieves persistence and execution by using the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to be loaded into the /bin/sshd process, where it hooks the 'accept' function. It features two C2 communication mechanisms: listening on a raw socket for specific ICMP packets that trigger a connect-back, or detecting a magic byte sequence in incoming SSH connections. Its capabilities include remote shell access (/bin/sh and /bin/csh), packet capture using libpcap, scheduling cron tasks via an embedded BusyBox instance, and creating a reverse SOCKS5 proxy by using code from the EarthWorm tool. All C2 communications are encrypted using TLS, and it authenticates the C2 server with a hardcoded CA certificate that masquerades as being issued by Fortinet.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Vendor of the XG firewall devices on which the Pygmy Goat malware was discovered.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: A network device vendor whose identity is impersonated by the malware's embedded Root CA Certificate. The report suggests Pygmy Goat may have been initially intended for FortiGate devices.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: A cybersecurity firm referenced in the report for their previous reporting on the EarthWorm tool and similar TTPs observed in attacks against FortiGate devices.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: A cybersecurity firm referenced in the report for their previous reporting on threat actors using the EarthWorm tool.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86

65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57
6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97
a4 b3 0f }

condition:

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them

}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$chartoi = {

8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB

EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1

}

condition:

}

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
